required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Midwifery Model in Palestine 2
clinical_study.official_title: The Palestinian Midwifery-led Continuity Model's Effect on Mothers' and Babies' Health Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: A midwife-led continuity model of care was implemented in governmental maternal facilities in Palestine. Midwives from the hospitals provided outreaching caseload ante- and postnatal care to women in rural villages clinics and homes. This study investigated if the model had impact on important maternal and neonatal health outcomes. A retrospective cohort design was used.

detailed_description.textblock:
Background: A midwife-led continuity model of care was implemented in governmental maternal facilities in Palestine. Midwives from the hospitals provided outreaching caseload ante- and postnatal care to women in rural villages clinics and homes. This study investigated if the model had impact on important maternal and neonatal health outcomes.
Method: A retrospective cohort design was used. Nablus governmental hospital, Rafidia's medical records were reviewed and data extracted involving 2199 women with singleton pregnancies, residing in rural villages, and their new-born babies born between January 2016 and February 2017. Outcomes were limited to the available information in the hospital`s birth registry. Important maternal outcomes were postpartum anaemia (Hb <11), mode of delivery and induction of labour. Important outcomes for new-borns were premature delivery < 37 weeks, birth weight < 2500g and 1500g and referral to neonatal intensive care unit. Outcomes were compared between women receiving the midwife-led continuity model of antenatal care and women receiving regular care.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of women undergoing emergency Caesarean section

secondary_outcome.description: Babies born before 37 weeks gestational age

secondary_outcome.measure: Post partum anaemia in the mother
secondary_outcome.description: Low Hb Level at discharge from hospital
The rate of women in each group who received induction of labour
Weight immediately post partum: Low (<2500g) Very low (<1500)
Rate of babies that were referred to neonatal intensive care during hospital stay
Rate of women receiving blood tranfusion during the hospital stay

arm_group.arm_group_label: Midwife led continuity model of care
arm_group.description: Women who received antenatal care from midwives from the hospital reaching out to the rural villages
Women who received care from doctors, nurses or midwives employed at primary Health care centres in rural villages

intervention.intervention_name: Midwife led continuity model of care
intervention.description: Midwives from the hospitals provided outreaching caseload ante- and postnatal care to women in rural villages clinics and homes
intervention.arm_group_label: Midwife led continuity model of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with singleton pregnancies residing in rural areas giving birth at Nablus governmental hospital, Palestine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple pregnancies
- Women residing in urban areas

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD can be obtained upon approval of the Palestinian Ministry of Health
